page.lettertext:
fol.9r
S
r
, After my hartie Commendac
o
ns. Althowgh wee
heare have not [herd] from yowe of a longe time, yet I doe not
impute it to yowe as anie fawlt in dilligence, but doe thinke
the cawse thereof partlie the lack of resoluc
o
n theare for
yo
r
awnsweare theare by the
States
to suche matters as yowe
weare prescribed to popound unto them, and partlie to the
hinderance of passage by contrarietie of windes, & tempestious
weather: But nowe yowe are to understand, that hir
ma
tie
hath sum Cawse to send for
S
r
Francis Veere
, and
therefore hath by hir l
re
s commaunded him to repaire hither
w
th
intenc
o
n to have sum conference w
th
him for
s
rvice
this p
nt
yeare against the Attempt
of the
K. of Spaine
And therefore hir
Ma
ties
pleasure is that yowe shall deale
w
th
the States generall theare, and the
Counsell
also, to
license him to retorne hither, w
th
such speed as he maie: &
thearein to perswade them that hir Ma
ties
purpose is by conference
w
th
them to further sum good exploite against the prowde
Attempt
and threates of the Spaniard. And I pray yowe
for my informac
o
n to advertise mee by yo
r
letter, what nombers
yowe thinke are extant of the Englishe people that did
voluntarelie goe owt of this Realme to
s
rve under him,
and wheare at this time such as be extant do [remaine] &
s
rve. I desire also to knowe what opinion is theare had
of the
Comte Hohenlo
of his affection to the States theare, &
whither he be as common report is revolted from them, to the
s
rvice of the Spaniard, w
th
the newe returned
Prince of
Orenge
and likewise what opinion is had of the disposic
o
n
of the said Prince towardes the cawse of the States and
his brother
Comte Maurice
./ I thinke shortlie to heare of
the comminge of the Deputies of the States: wishing that by
sum good offer to be made by them to hir Ma
tie
your [negotiac
o
n]
w
th
them might be the better allowed of hir Ma
tie
.
And
so for the p
nt
I wishe you all good fortune. From the
Cort this xiij
th
of Januarye
1595
.
Yo
r
assured Loving frend
William Burghley
